fig.show()
source.2c85f695:

fig.show()
source.500eb00f:
fig = px.bar(data, x="Bolge", y="Total", color="City", title="Total Vaccination as of June 26")
fig.show()
source.008f5bea:
fig = go.Figure()
fig.add_trace(go.Bar(
    x=data["Bolge"],
    y=data["Total"],
    name='Toplam Aşı'
))
fig.add_trace(go.Bar(
    x=data["Bolge"],
    y=data["Population"],
    name='Nüfus',
))

fig.show()

print("-"*30)

print("-"*30)
print("Total Vaccine:", sum(data["1_Dose"] + data["2_Dose"]))

         "Bugünkü İyileşen Sayısı": 7.402}
data_2 = {"Tarih" : "4 Ekim 2021",
         "Bugünkü Vaka Sayısı": 28.810,

source.44cb11ec: ### The data was taken on the 26th of June. We are now in October and let's see if there is a decrease in the number of deaths and serious patients in the current table.
source.bad9f313:
### When we compare the data, there is a big increase compared to June 26. In cases where there is an increase, the increase in the death rate draws the most attention. The reason for the increase in the death rate may be that the people who are vaccinated move around freely, increasing the transmission and thus putting the unvaccinated people at risk. It is mentioned that 99% of the deceased are people who have not been vaccinated (without information certainty).
### Another increase rate in the number of cases, the fact that those who have been vaccinated act as if they will not catch the disease, may be the main reason for this situation. People relaxed and took off the masks, so the disease began to spread more quickly. This seems to be the most logical reason to explain this situation.
### The only thing that makes us happy is the huge increase in the number of patients recovering. One of the factors in this increase is the fact that those who have been vaccinated survive the disease

source.2bf0cf4c: ### Here, I remove the columns that I will not use in the analysis from the data. I remove the ID column, the CITY column containing Turkish characters, the SEQID number given to the collective studies for each province, and the PREVID columns that give the previous transaction information. The reason I removed the previous transaction column is because the data contains only the date 2021-06-26 22:41:31.
